page.title: 05My visit to Ronez quarry
page.content: At Ronez quarry the lab technician told us about the blasting and we saw the tarmac machine. There is blasting once a week. We went to Sorrel point and saw the lorries going up and down the quarry tracks moving the stone and ground onto conveyor belts. The stone that is crushed is taken by lorries up the track onto the cliff top. You can see where they have blasted because the cliff crumbles away. The tracks have very hard wear because the lorries go over them every day. The lorries have carried tarmac to cover a{million}miles of road. Ronez aren't the only producers of tarmac & rock in Jersey but make most of it. They built their own road which is part of la Route du Nord.
